contentList.content: Fire
Beyond the eight traditional schools of magic, Wizards can also specialize in mastering primordial elements like Fire.
Hot Streak
When you land a Critical Hit against a creature using a Fire spell, the next Fire spell you cast costs a bonus action instead of an action.
Heating Up
Activate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="HOT_STREAK">Hot Streak!</LSTag> to make the next Fire spell you cast cost a bonus action instead of an action.
Hot Streak!
The next Fire spell you cast costs a bonus action instead of an action.
Critical Mass
The number you need to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">roll</LSTag> a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> with Fire spells is reduced by 1. This effect can stack.
Ignite
Dealing Fire damage with a spell applies [1] turns of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BURNING">Burning</LSTag> to the target.
Firestarter
Once per <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>, attacking a creature at full HP with a Fire Spell is a guaranteed Critical Hit.
Cauterize

Once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>, if you drop to [1] <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit point</LSTag>, you regain [2] instead of being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DOWNED">Downed</LSTag> and gain <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Dash">Dash</LSTag>.
Frost
Beyond the eight traditional schools of magic, Wizards can also specialize in mastering the force of cold.
Shatter

When using a Cold spell against a creatue that is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FROZEN">Frozen</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE_ICE">Prone</LSTag> from an Ice Surface, your <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attack</LSTag> has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> and the number you need to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">roll</LSTag> a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> is reduced by [1]. This effect can stack.
Splitting Ice
Your Cold spells that would normally target only 1 creature can target an additional creature.
Fingers of Frost

Dealing Cold damage to a creature grants you [1] turns of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ICICLES">Icicles</LSTag>. You can expend [2] turns of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ICICLES">Icicles</LSTag> to make your next Cold spell benefit from <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="Shatter">Shatter</LSTag> regardless of conditions.
Icicles
Accumulating Icicles from dealing Cold damage with Spells.
Expend [1] turns of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ICICLES">Icicles</LSTag> to make your next Cold spell benefit from <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="Shatter">Shatter</LSTag> regardless of conditions.
Your next Cold spell benefit from <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="Shatter">Shatter</LSTag> regardless of conditions.
Ice Block
Encase yourself in ice, becoming <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immune</LSTag> to damage but unable to move or take actions until the start of your next turn.
<LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immune</LSTag> to damage but unable to move or take actions until the start of your next turn.
Arcane
Beyond the eight traditional schools of magic, Wizards can also specialize in manipulating the very weave itself.
Clearcasting

You can directly spend your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery Charges</LSTag> to cast spells. The cost is equal to [1] less than the <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag> level (minimum 1), or [2] less for <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_MagicMissile">Magic Missile</LSTag>.

Whenever you expend a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag> in combat, you have a chance based on the spell's level to gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CLEARCASTING">Clearcasting</LSTag>, allowing you to cast your next spell without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag>.
The next spell you cast doesn't cost a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag>.
Savant
You now regain all your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery Charges</LSTag> after a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>.
Arcane Intellect
You and other members of your party gain a +[1] bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> to a maximum of 22.
Has a +[1] bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> to a maximum of 22.

Your cantrips become harder to evade entirely.

When a creature succeeds its Saving Throw or you miss your Attack Roll for one of your cantrips, it still takes half the cantrip's damage, but suffers no additional effects.
Chronomancy

Beyond the eight traditional schools of magic, a select few Wizards specialize in the greatest magic of all...

No, not friendship, what the fuck is wrong with you? Friends die all the time! All this "Love is the greatest magic of all" bullshit--so, in a war, a mother and her children get fucking iced in alleyway outside their home, was the problem that they didn't love eachother enough? That's crazy! Love is not magic! Love is love, magic is magic, and the greatest magic of all is CHRONOMANCY!
Time Warp
<LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="HASTE">Hasten</LSTag> all nearby allies.
Alter Time

Alter the fabric of time, making you return to your current position and approximate HP total [1] turns after casting. You can spend a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag> to activate this sooner.
Altering Time
Will return to the position and approximate HP total that the entity was at when casting <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_AlterTime">Alter Time</LSTag>.
Alter Time: Activate
Activate to teleport back to your previous position and return to approximately the same HP total.
Time Heals All Wounds
The list of spells you can learn is expanded to include a number of Healing spells not normally on the Wizard spell list.
Master of Time

Enemies have Disadvantage on Saving Throws against your Slow spell.

Creatures that you apply the Haste condition to will be Slowed for 1 turn when it expires instead of becoming Lethargic.
Time Lord

Once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>, when using <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_AlterTime">Alter Time</LSTag> you can also return to the amount of <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slots</LSTag> you had.
When your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_AlterTime">Alter Time</LSTag> completes, you will also return to the number of <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slots</LSTag> you had.
